SEARCH
Package grafioschtrader.priceupdate.historyquote

Class HistoryquoteImport

java.lang.Object
grafioschtrader.priceupdate.historyquote.HistoryquoteImport
public class HistoryquoteImport extends Object
Imports end-of-day (EOD) historical quotes from delimited CSV files into the database.

This class provides functionality to upload and process CSV files containing historical price data for securities. The CSV format requires:

  • First row must be column headers matching Historyquote field names
  • Semicolon (;) as field separator
  • Required fields marked with ImportDataRequired

Example CSV format: 

 date;close;open;high;low;volume
 2024-01-15;150.25;148.50;151.00;148.00;1000000
 2024-01-16;152.00;150.50;153.00;150.00;1200000

Processing features:

  • Automatic header-to-field mapping using entity annotations
  • Configurable date and number formats via SupportedCSVFormat
  • Duplicate detection (skips dates already in database)
  • Date range validation against security active period
  • Bean validation for imported records

The class uses CSVImportHelper for header-to-field mapping, which inspects the entity class for fields annotated with PropertyAlwaysUpdatable or PropertyOnlyCreation.

See Also:
  • Historyquote
  • CSVImportHelper
  • SupportedCSVFormat

  • Method Details

    • uploadHistoryquotes

      @Transactional @Modifying public UploadHistoryquotesSuccess uploadHistoryquotes(Integer idSecuritycurrency, org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile[] uploadFiles, SupportedCSVFormat supportedCSVFormat) throws Exception
      Uploads and processes a CSV file containing historical EOD quotes for a security.

      This method performs the following steps:

      1. Verifies user access to the target security
      2. Parses the CSV file using configurable format settings
      3. Maps CSV columns to Historyquote fields based on header names
      4. Validates each record and checks for duplicates
      5. Persists valid records to the database
      Parameters:
      idSecuritycurrency - the ID of the security to import quotes for
      uploadFiles - array of uploaded CSV files (only the first file is processed)
      supportedCSVFormat - format configuration specifying decimal separator, thousand separator, and date format to use when parsing values
      Returns:
      statistics about the import operation including success count, validation errors, duplicates skipped, and out-of-range records
      Throws:
      SecurityException - if the user doesn't have access to the specified security
      DataViolationException - if required columns are missing from the CSV header
      Exception - if file reading or processing fails
